message:
[27-Jun-2025 08:59:37 UTC] >>> CREATE TABLE wp_likes_posts(
				users_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
				post_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL ,
				PRIMARY KEY (users_ID, post_ID),
				KEY key_users_ID_1 (users_ID ASC) ,
				KEY key_postID_1 (post_ID ASC),
				CONSTRAINT like_post_users_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( users_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_users (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION,
				CONSTRAINT like_post_post_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( post_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_posts (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4;

				CREATE TABLE wp_likes_comments(
				users_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
				comment_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL ,
				PRIMARY KEY (users_ID, comment_ID),
				KEY key_users_ID_1 (users_ID ASC) ,
				KEY key_commentID_1 (comment_ID ASC),
				CONSTRAINT like_comment_user_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( users_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_users (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION,
				CONSTRAINT like_comment_comment_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( comment_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_comments (comment_ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4;

Check the browser console and network tabs for more information. ## Does the console show the error "No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header"? This means the server that hosts your file does not allow requests from other sites (cross-origin requests, or CORS). You need to move the asset to a server that allows cross-origin file downloads. Learn more about CORS at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS. If your file is on GitHub, load it from "raw.githubusercontent.com". Here's how to do that: 1. Start with the original GitHub URL of the file. For example: https://github.com/username/repository/blob/branch/filename. 2. Replace "github.com" with "raw.githubusercontent.com". 3. Remove the "/blob/" part of the URL. This means the server that hosts your file does not allow requests from other sites (cross-origin requests, or CORS). You need to move the asset to a server that allows cross-origin file downloads. Learn more about CORS at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS. If your file is on GitHub, load it from "raw.githubusercontent.com". Here's how to do that: 1. message:
[27-Jun-2025 08:59:37 UTC] >>> CREATE TABLE wp_likes_posts(
				users_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
				post_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL ,
				PRIMARY KEY (users_ID, post_ID),
				KEY key_users_ID_1 (users_ID ASC) ,
				KEY key_postID_1 (post_ID ASC),
				CONSTRAINT like_post_users_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( users_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_users (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION,
				CONSTRAINT like_post_post_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( post_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_posts (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4;

				CREATE TABLE wp_likes_comments(
				users_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
				comment_ID BIGINT(20) UNSIGNED NOT NULL ,
				PRIMARY KEY (users_ID, comment_ID),
				KEY key_users_ID_1 (users_ID ASC) ,
				KEY key_commentID_1 (comment_ID ASC),
				CONSTRAINT like_comment_user_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( users_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_users (ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION,
				CONSTRAINT like_comment_comment_1
					FOREIGN KEY ( comment_ID )
					REFERENCES wp_comments (comment_ID)
					ON DELETE NO ACTION
					ON UPDATE NO ACTION) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4;
